posts.name: Alex Cormier
posts.cooked:
Which CAD system do we all prefer nowadays?

ALSO, do you have a keyboard shortcut list that you look at to help during the process?

Since GrabCAD workshop shut down in 23, more and more ppl have been going to Onshape. The filesharing system is superb and things like featurescripts and FRCDesignlib/MKCad make life pretty easy. Some teams are still on solidworks (like us) but onshape has been getting bigger and bigger recently and seems a bit easier to get into than solidworks for training because of stuff like FRCDesign.org being much better than a lot of FRC -specific solidworks stuff. Also Solidworks filesharing is interesting now, weâ€™ve used 3dexperience (which is clunky imo) and CacheCAD (which is pretty good).
i love onshape, mostly because a lot of people use it, itâ€™s a web based cad software, and frcdesign.org is a great reasource

Im also going to highly recommend Onshape, Iâ€™ve found the workflow superior for FRC , collaboration unmatched, and the learning curve very easily overcome, especially with tools like http://frcdesign.org (which I highly recommend) and mkcad available. another plus is that itâ€™ll run on almost anything, be that a school Chromebook or a 2000$ custom PC, with virtually no issues and similar performance level

posts.name: Rich Jr
posts.cooked: I want to say OnShape, weâ€™re trying to move over to that but my old man brain is struggling with ditching Inventor

posts.name: Dillon
posts.cooked:
We use Fusion 360, mainly because that is what all of the mentors are framilar with. We had an idea for next year to possibly use a mix of Fusion and Onshape.

Also in our school we learn both Fusion and Onshape so everyone has a pretty good idea of how to use both even if they arenâ€™t on design.

Onshape is horrible! I just keep cadding and cadding and it doesnâ€™t crash or hang!! How am I supposed to break my addiction when I can do it on my phone, school chromebook, and home desktop without having to install a separate app??!? Its way too convenient!! The workflow I learned from FRCDesign is too well thought out and prevents me from designing myself into a corner and ragequitting!! The simplified models in FRCDesignlib & MKCad greatly reduce the lag I experience when designing and makes it so the dopamine loop is so tight!!! The featurescripts provided by the community have me spending my time in important design decisions instead of doing monotonous boilerplate design, so all the time I spend on cad is not boring and gets way too addictive!!!

Once you get started with onshape, there is no returnâ€¦ (Partially joking) On a serious note, Onshape is just really really good (especially in conjunction with FRCDesign as noted by others in this thread)

posts.name: Phong Nguyen
posts.cooked: those featurescripts really increase those regen times though, our hopper cad this year got up to like 18 seconds at one point.  although maybe that was because freshman worked on it and used 5 bajillion transforms.

you gotta be careful with with them for sure, but with proper workflow and some experience (knowing which ones to use and which ones are unperformant), onshape can be fairly performant and extremely capable

Soren_1:

How am I supposed to break my addiction

This is unfortunately too relatable
